name: Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - AS per TMP requirements. STMS to check site prior to work start. 2 hourly site checks when site attended. - Record checks on Forms
Criteria - As per TMP and ensure TMC advised in advance of works.
Specification Reference - Permit to Work,Digging Check list (inc. locating services),Close approach permit
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Before Work begins(only if required)
Criteria - Obtain permits and mark outs prior to construction
QA Form - Copy of Permit on site
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - As Requested
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Measuring Devices or Method - Scala Penetrometer testing of Subgrade - record No. blows per 50mm depth.
Inspection Test Plan - In Situ Cement Stabilisation
Test Required - Certified in accordance with NZS 3122
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - As per NZS 3122 Appendix E
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 1 per site
Specification Reference - NZTA B/5:2008, 7.7, NZS 4402 Test 4.1.3, NZS 4407 Test 3.7.1
Test Required - Material properties for compaction verification
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 1 per 5000m2 of material stabilised
Task Assigned To - Hold Point - Approval required by site engineer
In-situ moisture content of existing pavement aggregate
Specification Reference - NZTA B/5:2008, 7.5 NZS 4402 Test 41.3
Test Required - In-situ moisture content Between 90% to 100% of OWC
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - As required
Test Required - Placed to required depth and design levels
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 20m intervals - Stringline
Test Required - Mat test ± 0.5 kg/m2 of specified rate; Average usage ±2.5% of specified rate
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Inspection & sign off by Site Supervisor
Task Assigned To - Inspection & sign off by Site Supervisor
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Every 200m along cut length at both ends of the drum
Task Assigned To - Inspection & sign off by Site Supervisor
Specification Reference - NZTA B/5:2008, 7.7.1 NZS 4402 Test 41.3
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 5 Randomly selected locations / lot, Lot size ≤ 1000m2
Task Assigned To - Hold Point - Approval required by site engineer
Measuring Devices or Method - Nuclear Densometer
Test Required - ≤10mm from 3-metre straight edge, No depression, Vertical variations -5 + 15mm
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 20m intervals
Task Assigned To - Inspection & sign off by Site Supervisor
Measuring Devices or Method - Stringing, Tape measure
Test Required - Not less than exisitng crossfall at the start of construction
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 20m intervals
Task Assigned To - Inspection & sign off by Site Supervisor
Measuring Devices or Method - Stringing, Tape measure
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 20m intervals
Task Assigned To - Hold Point - Approval required by site engineer prior to Sealing
* Normal Risk = < 5 x 106 ESA's  (or < 500 HCV per lane per day)
** High Risk  = > 5 x 106 ESA's  (or > 500 HCV per lane per day)
Specification Reference - Refer TEMPORARY TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT Section
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to surfacing (HOLD POINT)
Criteria - Seal design to be reviewed prior to surfacing
Test Required - Mark up extent of chipseal
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to surfacing
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to application of binder
Criteria - To confirm that all loose material is removed from the surface and surrounding area.
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to start of Sealing
Criteria - Ensure all plant set ready to go. (i.e. Trucks loaded, Roller ready etc.)
Test Required - Binder type, Cutback, Temp, Application rates
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to application of binder. Site Foreman/ Bitumen Sprayer Operator to confirm adjustment and record reason to application prior to start.
Task Assigned To - Site Foreman/ Bitumen Sprayer Operator
Criteria - Binder Type = 180/200. Cutback to suit 1st coat seal 4pph kero max. Temp = 150deg celcius min, Application = Design l/m2, +/- 0.1 l/m2.
Test Required - Chip type, Chip Application
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Prior to application of chip and preferably prior to application of binder
Criteria - Trucks loaded with correct chip.
○ G4 application = windows big enough for 1-2 G6 chips to fall between G4.
○ G6 application = Enough to just fill the voids around the G4.
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - At completion of rolling
Criteria - Ensure sufficient passes with roller to embed chip (typically 4-5 passes)
Test Required - Record final site measure
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Completion of works
Measuring Devices or Method - Measuring Wheel or Tape
Criteria - Sketch and record seal area and QA detail
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - 4 hours after Surfacing

Criteria - Ensure sufficient resource and positive traffic management in place to protect new seal. Physical management (i.e. Cones used to run traffic off the normal wheel path) mandatory for the first 4 hours.
Chip Removal, Pavement Marking, Traffic Services
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Within 48 hours of surfacing
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Criteria - Ensure all excess chip removed from site. No chip windrows left on site in Shoulders.
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Within 48 hours of surfacing
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Criteria - Linemarking must be completed within 48 hours of surfacing.
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Within 48 hours of surfacing
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Criteria - All Temporary Traffic Management must be removed within 48 hours provided site is safe (i.e. excess chip removed, line marking completed).
Task Timing / Minimum Task Frequency - Within 48 hours of surfacing
Task Assigned To - Project Engineers/Site Foreman
Criteria - Completed installation of all EMPs, RRPM's, Signs etc
